column5: Spent this weekend back on the ice, Lots of people out all over Kemp. Ice conditions were still inconsistant some 6" some 3". Lots of people still ignoring warnings and driving sleds all over the lake. Anyways back to the fishing. Was out with some buddies, Dan (GBaysteel) and Braden (maple leaf Drifter)Saturday was a write off. We found lots of fish but only managed to miss a few.We threw everything thinkable at them with no luck.Didint see a whole lot being caught. We Decided to go ahead and try it again on Sunday.The weather was great. Not near as many people out, I guess Saturdays bad bite kept them at home. We had a great day, landed 7 lakers and missed at least a dozen more fish. we moved around and followed the fish from 110ft to 80ft. moved in and out, when they stopped marking we would move and it always paid off with a couple fish coming on each move.Fish were split half on minnows and half on spoons.  pic of the bay and the crowds enjoying the weekend   Dan with the first fish   My first one of the day and the year on simcoe for that matter not a bad way to start about 5lbs   Dan with #2   My second   Braden with his first Simcoe Laker   Dan had a good day hitting 3 fish on the spoon   Dan with #3   fight shot   Dan with #4    Kept a couple for the table and the rest went back to fight another day.   Ryan
looks like a pretty good day on the ice! THanks for sharing.
I saw over hundred herring swamming about 10 fow. Amazing!
congrats on a good time out there
Nice fish, thx for the report   Greg
You boyz had a good day, WTG...
Looks like agreat day had by all.  Nice day for it  Cheers  Craig
Great catch guys !!!!...nice fishing report & pics too.  ..glad to see that the trout grounds are getting safe,and they are hitting good,well done guys !!!....cheers
